rules: Rule1: Either the farmer uses pesticide on crops or the farmer does not have a loan with the bank.
Rule2: In the event that the farmer increases the yield of crops, the farmer is profitable in the season.
Rule3: Should the farmer reduce the cost of production, then the farmer increases the yield of crops.
Rule4: If the farmer defaults on the loan, the bank forecloses on the farm.
Rule5: Given that the farmer defaults on the loan, it is not the case that the bank forecloses on the farm.
Rule6: If it is not the case that investing in an irrigation system leads to reduced production costs, then the farmer sells land to an investor.
Rule7: Assuming that investing in an irrigation system does not result in reduced production costs, the farmer does not sell land to an investor.
Rule8: When the investment in an irrigation system does not make the farmer profitable in the season, the farmer has a loan with the bank.
Rule9: In cases where investing in an irrigation system fails to yield profitability for the farmer in the season, the farmer defaults on the loan.
facts: Fact1: The farmer invests in an irrigation system.
Fact2: It is not the case that the farmer uses pesticide on crops.

question: The farmer is profitable in the season.
